conclusion: A hemispherical transparent medium with radius R and refractive index sqrt(2410)/30, with point O as the center, and an isosceles right triangle glass brick SMN.
B is the midpoint of MN, BO is the vertical hypotenuse with length R/4, MN and PQ are parallel and equal.
A beam of monochromatic light enters the glass brick from midpoint A of SM and reaches points B, C, and D.

The image shows a hemispherical medium with a radius R, refractive index sqrt(2410)/30, and a glass brick SMN. Point O is the center, BO is a vertical hypotenuse, and light paths through the medium and glass brick are shown.
The glass brick is an isosceles right triangle with B as the midpoint of MN.
The length of BO is R/4, and MN is parallel and equal to PQ.
The refractive index of the medium is sqrt(2410)/30.
Using the relationship n1/n2 = OC/OB = 3R/4 / R/4 = 3/1, where n1 is the refractive index of the glass brick, and n2 is the refractive index of the medium.
Solving for n1, we have n1 = 3/1 * n2 = 3/1 * sqrt(2410)/30 = sqrt(2410)/10.
The refractive index of the glass brick is sqrt(2410)/10.
